alert.note: Alert for John Day Basin (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 2:29AM PDT until May 10 at 11:01AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Oregon... John Day River at Service Creek affecting John Day Basin zone. For the John Day River...including John Day, Monument, Service Creek...flooding is possible. Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon John Day River Service Creek 11.5 10.7 Thu 12 pm PD 12.1 12.3 11.6 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pdt. ORZ505-052200- /O.CON.KPDT.FL.A.0002.230505T2129Z-230510T1801Z/ /SERO3.0.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 229 AM PDT Fri May 5 2023 ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...John Day River at Service Creek. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM PDT Thursday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
